trans-unit.source: Represents an interoperable binding that supports distributed transactions and secure, reliable sessions.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSHttpBinding> is similar to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.BasicHttpBinding> but provides more Web service features.

It uses the HTTP transport and provides message security, as does <xref:System.ServiceModel.BasicHttpBinding>, but it also provides transactions, reliable messaging, and WS-Addressing, either enabled by default or available through a single control setting.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.WSHttpBinding"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.WSHttpBinding"></xref> class with a specified type of security used by the binding.
The value of <xref href="System.ServiceModel.SecurityMode"></xref> that specifies the type of security that is used with the SOAP message and for the client.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.WSHttpBinding"></xref> class with a binding specified by its configuration name.
The binding configuration name for the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Configuration.WSHttpBindingElement"></xref>.
The binding element with the name configName was not found.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.WSHttpBinding"></xref> class with a specified type of security used by the binding and a value that indicates whether a reliable session is enabled.
The value of <xref href="System.ServiceModel.SecurityMode"></xref> that specifies the type of security that is used with the SOAP message and for the client.
`true` if a reliable session is enabled; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the WCF client will automatically store and resend any cookies sent by a single web service.
Setting <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSHttpBinding.AllowCookies%2A> to `true` is useful when a client is interacting with one web service that uses cookies.

If you are accessing multiple services with the same cookie, set <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSHttpBinding.AllowCookies%2A> to `false` and you will have to manually add the cookie header to each outgoing message.
The following code shows how to do this:
`True` if automatic cookies processing is required; otherwise, `false`.
Builds the channel factory stack on the client that creates a specified type of channel and that satisfies the features specified by a collection of binding parameters.
Specifies the requirements for the channel factory built.
The type of channel the channel factory produces.
An <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.IChannelFactory`1"></xref> of type TChannel that satisfies the features specified by the collection.
Returns an ordered collection of binding elements contained in the current binding.
The order of the binding elements is important.
It reflects the order in which the protocol and transport channels are constructed and stacked.

The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingElementCollection"></xref> that contains the ordered stack of binding elements described by the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.WSHttpBinding"></xref> binding.
The transport security mode set cannot provide the reliable session that has been enabled.
Returns the security binding element from the current binding.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.SecurityBindingElement"></xref> from the current binding.
Returns the transport binding element from the current binding.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.TransportBindingElement"></xref> from the current binding.
Gets the security settings used with this binding.
To use something other than the default security type, use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSHttpBinding.%23ctor%28System.ServiceModel.SecurityMode%29> constructor.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.WSHttpSecurity"></xref> that is used with this binding.
The default value <xref href="System.ServiceModel.WSHttpSecurity.Mode"></xref> property is <xref href="System.ServiceModel.WSHttpSecurity.Message"></xref>.
Returns a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.WSHttpBinding.Security"></xref> property has changed from its default value and should be serialized.
`true` if the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.WSHttpBinding.Security"></xref> property value should be serialized; otherwise, `false`.
